intro: Calymmodon ponapensis, commonly known as the Ponapé daisy, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to saline and sandy soils. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and it produces small, oval-shaped fruits. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
